newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela to persist with forex bands in 97 - Matos.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela to persist with forex bands in 97 - Matos.

text.p: Venezuela will continue with its current system of foreign exchange bands in 1997 and expects no sharp variations in the exchange rate for the foreseeable future, Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar said Wednesday.
"We guarantee exchange rate stability in 1997 and the system of bands will be maintained," Matos said during a breakfast meeting with foreign journalists.
"Investors can base their calculations on the current exchange rate," Matos added.
The Venezuelan Central Bank introduced a bands system soon after the government relaxed foreign exchange controls in April.
Under the bands system a central exchange rate of 470 bolivars per dollar was established and upper and lower limits of 7.5 percent either side set.
Despite the wide band, the exchange rate has varied little from 470 bolivars per dollar leading some analysts to suggest the bands system be scrapped.
